p: The leaves of T. koraiensis have a high content of vitamin C, being used by the American natives and the first European explorers as a treatment for scurvy. The leaves of this tree have also been used as a treatment for rheumatism [ 22]. T. koraiensis oil is a known remedy with topical application in the treatment of the human papilloma virus (HPV), as well as for genital or common warts treatment [ 23], as an antioxidant [ 24], and for antibacterial properties [ 22].
